name: The Forge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were asked by some American friends to find a nice B & B in The Cotswolds . We found The Forge on the Internet and booked. They were very helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Although not having a restaurant there was an pub opposite which served an ambitious menu which was extremely good. The service was good and the beer excellent ! If we go to that area I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Pleasant and friendly

likes.disliked: — Rooms a little small but standard size fro the UK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely house in the quiet Cotswold village of Churchill. We stayed here after checking out of a dreadful pub in Chipping Norton and were hugely relieved. The greeting was genuinely warm and the room was very comfortable. Breakfast was of a very high standard with plenty of choice. The decor may not be the latest, but that was low on our list of priorities.
reviews.title: Peaceful, Friendly B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's nothing much in Churchill other than a handsome church, a nice-looking pub and some beautiful houses, but if you appreciate peace and quiet, this is the place for you.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

description: Located in the Cotswolds, the heart of rural England, The Forge is almost 200 years old and was once the village blacksmith‘s. In more recent years it has been converted into the warm and comfortable home it is today, while retaining many of the original features. Five rooms are available and all have en-suite baths with showers or a shower-room, two are equipped with Whirlpool baths, three rooms have traditional four-poster beds.
